summary: Redesign dashboard UI with dark-first professional theme using Sora/DM Sans/JetBrains Mono fonts and teal accent color
context: The dashboard UI was using generic system fonts, basic blue accent, and a light-first design. User requested a professional UI that can be extended with new functionality. Three bugs also needed fixing: project name showing '.' for relative paths, tabs not closing on session end, and duplicate tabs opening.
rationale: Dark-first design matches developer tool context (terminal/IDE environments). Sora provides geometric, modern headings; DM Sans is clean and readable for body text; JetBrains Mono is the definitive developer monospace font. Teal accent (#00d4aa) is distinctive without being generic blue. CSS custom properties throughout enable easy theming and extension.

alternatives.option: Keep system fonts and just fix bugs
alternatives.reason_rejected: User explicitly asked for a professional UI redesign, not just bug fixes

alternatives.option: Use a CSS framework like Tailwind or Bootstrap
alternatives.reason_rejected: Dashboard is a self-contained vanilla JS SPA; adding a framework increases complexity and bundle size for minimal gain
Developer tools are typically used alongside dark terminals and IDEs; dark-first is more cohesive with the workflow
